      • addEmployee

        public Employee addEmployee(java.lang.String name,
                            int employeeNumber,
                            OurDate Startdate,
                            double salary,
                            int empType)
        Method to add employee into the Employee Array. add a switch() statement to choose which of the three subclasses to instantiate based on the new parameter (Manager, Staff, Temp) It will return to the loadExtraInfo() of which subclass.
        Parameters:
        name -
        employeeNumber -
        date -
        salary -
        emptype -
        Returns:
        Employee

        A current number of employee method. It return the size of array.
        Returns:
        int

      • isMaximumEmployees

        public boolean isMaximumEmployees()

      • deleteEmployee

        public Employee deleteEmployee(int empNum)
        Delete employee's method. Search the employee through the nested array. If the chosen number wasn't matched with the Employee Number, it will return a message that "Employee can't be found", otherwise, it deletes the employee based on their number.
        Parameters:
        empNumber -
        Returns:
        Employee

      • findEmployee

        public Employee findEmployee(int empNum)
        Find employee's method. Search the employee through the nested array. If the chosen number wasn't matched with the Employee Number, it will return a message that "Employee can't be found", otherwise, it returns the employee based on their number. Same method of Delete Employee
        Parameters:
        empNumber -
        Returns:
        Employee

      • getEmployees

        public java.util.ArrayList<Employee> getEmployees()
        Return a reference to the array of Employees
        Returns:
        ArrayList

      • findSeniorEmployee

        public Employee findSeniorEmployee()
        Find senior employee by converting the start date of each non-null employee in the employees array to its Calendar equivalent, and using Calendar's before() method to determine which date is earliest. The index of the earliest start date is used to return a new instance of the most senior employee
        Returns:
        Employee

      • saveEmployeeToFile

        public void saveEmployeeToFile()
        Saves current employees list to file. Uses try/catch block to catch IOException that are common with File IO Writes employee Object to the file created. Closes the file

      • loadEmployeeFromFile

        public void loadEmployeeFromFile()
        Loads an employee Arraylist from file. Uses try/catch block to catch EOFException, IOExceptio, ClassNotFOundException.
